diff_hunk:
@@ -262,18 +262,32 @@
 
 
 (defn results-el
-  []
-  [:div (use-style results-heading-style)
-   [:h5 "Results"]
-   [:span (use-style hint-style)
-    "Press "
-    [:kbd "shift + enter"]
-    " to open in right sidebar."]])
+  [state]
+  (let [recent-item-length 40
+        search-term? (str/blank? (:query @state))]
+    [:<> [:div (use-style results-heading-style)
+          [:h5 (if search-term? "Recent" "Results")]
+          [:span (use-style hint-style)
+           "Press "
+           [:kbd "shift + enter"]
+           " to open in right sidebar."]]
+     (when search-term?
+       [:div (use-style results-list-style)
+        (doall
+          (for [[i x] (map-indexed list (take recent-item-length @(subscribe [:athena/get-recent])))]
body:
Great use of `list`, can you change the other `map-indexed` to use this?

`subscribe` should happen in the `let` binding above.

```
(let [recent-items @(subscribe [:athena/get-recent]
      search-term? (str/blank? (:query @state))]
...

(for [[i x] (map-indexed list recent-items) 

...
```

Don't worry about `take`ing `recent-item-length` for now. If we want to only ever show `40`, we can specify that condition in the dispatch so that the data structure doesn't grow needlessly. Just show all recent items for now.
